CatDescriptText: Mrs. Thelma Snowden, domestic worker, 632 Burrows Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 14, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that the Federal Government should provide financial aid for students of exceptional ability to further their education when the students are unable to do so for themselves?" answer reads: "It's a very good idea, because so many of our people do not have the money to finance the education of their children."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Thelma Snowden wearing flecked coat with two buttons, hat, and earrings, posed in front of block wall
